importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication, indicating the most recent update on college football game outcomes and team performance.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The game between Michigan and Washington occurred on Saturday, October 18, 2025, and the article reports on its outcome and immediate aftermath.

keyTakeAways: Michigan defeated Washington 24-7 in a college football game on October 18, 2025.
Jordan Marshall ran for a tiebreaking 14-yard touchdown after an interception by Washington quarterback Demond Williams Jr., helping Michigan take a 14-7 lead.
Bryce Underwood threw two touchdown passes, including a 22-yard and a 10-yard pass, contributing to Michigan's offensive success.
Michigan's defense intercepted Washington quarterback Demond Williams Jr. twice in a key stretch and recovered from turnovers, marking a turning point in the game.
Washington's quarterback Demond Williams Jr. was picked off three times in five pass attempts, highlighting offensive struggles and poor execution.
Both teams were 5-2 on the season, with Michigan improving to 3-1 in the Big Ten and Washington to 2-2.
Michigan played without injured running back Justice Haynes and defensive back Rod Moore, while Washington lost tight end Quentin Moore to injury during the game.
Michigan's offensive performance improved after a previous loss to USC, where they gave up 31 points.
Washington coach Jedd Fisch, a former Michigan assistant, criticized his teamâ€™s lack of coaching and execution.
The game underscores the importance of defensive discipline and offensive resilience in college football.

namedEntities.name: Jordan Marshall
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: College football player, running back for Michigan
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Marshall played in place of injured Justice Haynes and had a career-high 133 yards rushing, including a decisive 14-yard touchdown run after an interception.

namedEntities.name: Bryce Underwood
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: College football player, quarterback for Michigan
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Underwood threw two touchdown passes in the game, matching a season high, and was praised by head coach Sherrone Moore for his clean, effective play.

namedEntities.name: Demond Williams Jr.
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: College football player, quarterback for Washington
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Williams was intercepted three times in a key stretch, including one on the first snap of Washington's next drive, contributing to the Huskies' defensive collapse and Michigan's lead.

namedEntities.name: Michigan
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: College football team, University of Michigan Wolverines
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Michigan emerged victorious over Washington, with a strong defensive performance and improved offensive execution, marking a turning point after a previous loss to USC.

namedEntities.name: Washington
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Washington struggled offensively and defensively, falling to Michigan 24-7, with quarterback Demond Williams Jr. being intercepted multiple times and a key player, Quentin Moore, being injured during the game.

namedEntities.name: Sherrone Moore
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Head coach of the Michigan football team
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Moore praised the team's defensive improvement and emphasized team unity, stating it felt like 'Michigan football and what it should feel like.'

namedEntities.name: Jedd Fisch
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Head coach of the Washington football team
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Fisch criticized his team's coaching and execution, citing poor decision-making and failure to capitalize on opportunities during the game.

namedEntities.name: Cole Sullivan
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Sullivan recorded the first interception of the game and emphasized the need for defensive discipline after a recent poor performance.

namedEntities.name: Justice Haynes
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: College football player, running back for Michigan
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Haynes was injured and replaced by Jordan Marshall, who had a career-high performance in his place.

namedEntities.name: Quentin Moore
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: College football player, tight end for Washington
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Moore was carted off the field during the game due to injury and was taken to a hospital for precautionary reasons.

namedEntities.name: Evan Link
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: College football player, left tackle for Michigan
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Link sustained a lower-body injury and was carted off the field during the game, impacting Michigan's defensive lineup.

namedEntities.name: Andrew Marsh
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: College football player, receiver for Michigan
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Marsh caught a 22-yard touchdown pass from Bryce Underwood, contributing to Michigan's scoring in the first quarter.

namedEntities.name: Zach Marshall
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: College football player, receiver for Michigan
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Zach Marshall caught a 10-yard touchdown pass from Bryce Underwood in the fourth quarter, helping seal Michigan's victory.

namedEntities.name: Jonah Coleman
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: College football player, running back for Washington
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Coleman had a 1-yard touchdown run that tied the game at 7-all in the second quarter before Washington failed to score again.

summaryOfNewsArticle: In a college football game on October 18, 2025, the Michigan Wolverines defeated the Washington Huskies 24-7. Jordan Marshall, playing in place of injured Justice Haynes, had a career-high 133 yards on the ground and scored a crucial 14-yard touchdown after Washington quarterback Demond Williams Jr. was intercepted. Bryce Underwood threw two touchdown passes, including a 22-yard and a 10-yard pass, to help Michigan's offense. Michigan's defense, which had struggled in the previous week's loss to USC, excelled by intercepting Williams twice in a key stretch and recovering from turnovers. Washington, led by Williams, faced offensive difficulties, with Williams being picked off three times in five attempts, and tight end Quentin Moore was injured during the game. Michigan, now 5-2 and 3-1 in the Big Ten, continued a rebuilding phase after falling out of the AP Top 25, while Washington fell to 5-2 and 2-2. The game highlighted the importance of defensive discipline, offensive consistency, and team resilience in college football.
title: Michigan Beats Washington 24-7 in Key College Football Game
